Core.about: The Core of the body is broadly considered to be the torso. Functional movements are highly dependent on this part of the body, and lack of core muscular development can result in a predisposition to injury.

Chest.about: The Chest includes the thoracic cavity and the thoracic wall. It contains organs including the heart, lungs, and other internal structures. Muscles in chest increases the size of chest and strength.

Back.about: The human back is the large posterior area of the human body, rising from the top of the buttocks to the back of the neck and the shoulders. It is the surface of the body opposite from the chest. The vertebral column runs the length of the back and creates a central area of recession.
